landing_page.h2: Ensure the reliability of the other party and get your agreements fulfilled.
landing_page.box_1_content: Search other parties profile to look at their trust rate. We calculate it based on the perfectage of agreements fulfilled.
landing_page.box_2_content: Once signed by both parts, the agreement will be encrypted and stored in the blockchain, ensuring its immutability.
landing_page.box_3_title: Enforce the fulfillment of your agreements
landing_page.box_3_content: You will evaluate the fullfilment of the other part when the agreement is completed. This feedback will be public, enforcing good behaviour.

create_contract_page.title: Create a new contract:
create_contract_page.contract_title_placeholder: Introduce the title of the contract
create_contract_page.content: Contract Content (Describe all the details and clauses of the contract)
create_contract_page.content_placeholder: Introduce the content of the contract
create_contract_page.email: Email of the person you want to send the contract
create_contract_page.email_placeholder: Introduce the email of the person you want to send the contract
create_contract_page.dont_have_account: User doesn't have an eTrust account
create_contract_page.want_to_send_invitation: doesn't have an eTrust account. Do you want to send him and invitation?

deal_details.contract_successfully_edited_2: has been successfully edited. The other member of the contract has been notified about the change.

deal_details_form.title_placeholder: Introduce the title of the contract
deal_details_form.content: Contract Content (Describe all the details and clauses of the contract)
deal_details_form.content_placeholder: Introduce the content of the contract

rating_form.rate_contract: Rate the fulfillment of the contract:
rating_form.successfully_added: Your rating has been successfully added.

privacy_policy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy_policy.2-content-1: The types of Personal Data collected by this Application, either directly or through third parties, include: geographic location; Tracker; Usage Data; first name; last name(s); email address; password; image; user data.
privacy_policy.2-content-2: Full information concerning each category of Personal Data that is collected is provided in the sections of this privacy policy dedicated to that purpose or by specific explanatory texts displayed prior to the collection of such Data.
privacy_policy.2-content-3: Personal Data may be freely provided by the User or, in the case of the Terms of Use, will be collected automatically when using this Application.
privacy_policy.2-content-4: All Data requested by this Application are mandatory and refusal to provide them may make it impossible for this Application to provide the Service. In cases where this Application specifically indicates that certain Data are not mandatory, Users are free not to provide such Data without this having any consequence on the availability or operation of the Service. Users who are in doubt as to which Data are mandatory may contact the Owner.
privacy_policy.2-content-5: The use of Cookies - or other tracking tools - by this Application or by the owners of third party services used by this Application is for the purpose of providing the Service requested by the User, in addition to any other purposes described in this document and in the Cookies Policy, if available.
privacy_policy.2-content-6: The User assumes responsibility for the Personal Data of third parties that are collected, published or shared through this Application and hereby declares that he/she has the consent of such third parties to provide such Data to the Data Controller Modality and place of the processing of the Data collected.
privacy_policy.3-content-1: The Data Controller shall treat Users’ Data in an appropriate manner and shall take appropriate security measures to prevent unauthorised access, disclosure, alteration or destruction of the Data.
privacy_policy.3-content-2: The processing of Data will be carried out by means of computers and/or IT tools, following procedures and organisational modalities strictly related to the aforementioned purposes. In addition to the Data Controller, the Data may in some cases be accessed by certain categories of authorised persons related to the operation of this Application (administration, sales, marketing, legal and systems administration departments) or by external contractors providing services to the Data Controller (such as external technical service providers, courier companies, hosting companies, IT companies, communication agencies) who will be appointed by the Data Controller as Data Processors, if necessary. An updated list of such persons may be requested from the Data Controller at any time.
privacy_policy.4-content-1: The Data Controller may process the User’s Personal Data, if one of the following conditions is met:
privacy_policy.4-content-2: When Users have given their consent for one or more specific purposes. Notice:
privacy_policy.4-content-3: Under several different legislations, the Data Controller may be allowed to process Personal Data until the User opts out (“opt-out”), without the need for consent or any other legal basis. However, this does not apply where the processing of Personal Data is subject to European legislation on the protection of Personal Data;
privacy_policy.4-content-4: When the collection of the Data is necessary for the performance of a contract between the User and/or any other pre-contractual obligations of the User;
privacy_policy.4-content-5: Where the processing is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation of the User;
privacy_policy.4-content-6: Where the processing is related to a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official powers vested in the Data Controller;
privacy_policy.4-content-7: Where the processing is necessary for the purposes of a legitimate interest pursued by the Data Controller or a third party.
privacy_policy.4-content-8: In any case, the Data Controller is at his disposal to define the specific legal bases that apply to the processing and in particular, whether the collection of the Personal Data is a contractual or statutory requirement or a requirement necessary to enter into a contract.
privacy_policy.5-content-1: The Data are processed through the means of the Data Controller, as well as at any other place where the parties involved in such processing are located.
privacy_policy.5-content-2: Depending on the location of Users, transfers of Data may involve the transfer of Users’ Data to a country other than their own. For more information on the place of processing of such transferred Data, Users may refer to the section containing details on the processing of Personal Data.
privacy_policy.5-content-3: Users shall also have the right to know the legal basis for transfers of Data to another country outside the European Union or to any international body governed by international public law or consisting of two or more countries, such as the UN, and furthermore to know the security measures taken by the Data Controller to safeguard their Data.
privacy_policy.5-content-4: In the event of such a transfer of Data, Users may obtain further information by consulting the relevant sections of this document or by requesting it from the Data Controller through the contact information provided in the contact section.
privacy_policy.6-content-1: The Personal Data will be processed and kept for the time necessary and for the purpose for which they have been collected.
privacy_policy.6-content-3: Personal Data collected for the purpose of entering into a contract between the Data Controller and the User shall be retained as such until such contract has been fully concluded.
privacy_policy.6-content-4: Personal Data collected in the legitimate interest of the Data Controller shall be retained for the time necessary to fulfil that purpose. Users can find specific information related to the legitimate interest of the Data Controller by consulting the relevant sections of this document or by contacting the Data Controller.
privacy_policy.6-content-5: The Data Controller may retain Personal Data for an additional period where the User consents to such processing, provided that such consent remains valid. In addition, the Data Controller shall be obliged to retain Personal Data for an additional period if this is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation or an order from an authority.
privacy_policy.6-content-6: Once the retention period has expired, the Personal Data must be deleted. Therefore, the rights of access, modification, rectification and data portability may not be exercised after the expiry of this period.
privacy_policy.7-title: Purpose of the processing of the data collected
privacy_policy.7-content-1: User Data is collected to enable the Owner to provide its Service, fulfil its legal obligations, respond to enforcement requests, protect its rights and interests (or those of its Users or third parties), detect any malicious or fraudulent activity, as well as for the following purposes: Location-based interactions, Statistics and Registration and authentication provided directly by this Application.
privacy_policy.7-content-2: Users can find specific information on the Personal Data used for each purpose in the section “Detailed information on the Processing of Personal Data”.
privacy_policy.8-title: Detailed information on the Processing of Personal Data
privacy_policy.8-content-1: Personal Data is collected for the following purposes and using the following services:
privacy_policy.8-content-4: This Application may collect, use and share the User’s geographic location data for the purpose of providing location-based services to the User. Most browsers and devices provide by default means to disable geo-tracking. If the User has expressly consented to such a possibility, this Application may receive information about the User’s actual geographic location. Personal data processed: geographical position.
privacy_policy.8-content-5: Registration and authentication provided directly by this Application
privacy_policy.8-content-6: By registering or authenticating, the User allows this Application to identify him/her and give him/her access to dedicated services. Personal Data is collected and stored for registration or identification purposes only. Only the Data necessary for the provision of the service requested by the Users are collected.
privacy_policy.8-content-8: The User registers by filling in the registration form and providing their Personal Data directly to this Application. In order to verify the account, a current image will be required to validate the ID card, or information that verifies the VAT number. Personal data processed: surname(s); e-mail address; image; name; password; IP address of the access device; ID or Tax ID number.
privacy_policy.8-content-10: The services contained in this section allow the Owner to monitor and analyse web traffic and may be used to track User behaviour.
privacy_policy.8-content-12: Google Analytics is a web analytics service provided by Google Ireland Limited (“Google”). Google uses the Data collected to track and examine the use of this Application, to pre-stop reports on its activities and to share them with other Google services. Google may use the Data collected to contextualise and personalise ads in its own advertising network. Personal Data processed: Usage data; Tracker.
privacy_policy.8-content-13: Place of processing: Ireland - Privacy Policy - Opt Out
privacy_policy.8-content-14: Personal Data collected through other resources and not provided by Users
privacy_policy.8-content-15: The Controller of this Application may have collected Personal Data from Users in a lawful manner without their knowledge, reusing them or obtaining them from third parties on the basis of the grounds mentioned in the section specifying the legal basis for the processing. Where the Data Controller has obtained Personal Data through such a method, Users may find specific information about it in the relevant sections of this document or by contacting the Data Controller
privacy_policy.9-content-1: Users may exercise certain rights with respect to the processing of Data by the Holder. In particular, Users have the right to do the following:
privacy_policy.9-content-2: Withdraw your consent at any time.
privacy_policy.9-content-3: Users have the right to withdraw their consent to the processing of their Personal Data if they have previously given it.
privacy_policy.9-content-4: Objection to the processing of your Data.
privacy_policy.9-content-5: Users have the right to object to the processing of their Data if such processing is carried out on a legal basis other than consent. For more information, please refer to the relevant section below.
privacy_policy.9-content-7: Users have the right to know whether their Data will be processed by the Data Controller, to obtain in- formation on certain aspects of the processing, and to obtain a copy of the Data undergoing processing.
privacy_policy.9-content-9: Users have the right to verify the accuracy of their Data and to request that it be updated or corrected.
privacy_policy.9-content-10: Restrict the processing of your Data.
privacy_policy.9-content-11: Users have the right, in certain cases, to restrict the processing of their Data. In such a case, the Data Controller will process their Data for the sole purpose of storing them. Delete or remove Personal Data.
privacy_policy.9-content-13: Users have the right, in certain cases, to obtain the deletion of their Data by the Data Controller.
privacy_policy.9-content-14: Receive your Data and transfer it to another Data Controller.
privacy_policy.9-content-15: Users have the right to receive their Data in a standard, structured, machine-readable format and, if technically possible, to have it transferred to another controller without hindrance. This provision shall apply provided that the Data have been processed by automated means and that the processing is based on the User’s consent, on a contract to which the User is a party or appears in the User’s pre-contractual obligations
privacy_policy.9-content-17: Users have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent authority for the protection of personal data.
privacy_policy.10-title: Details on the right to object to processing
privacy_policy.10-content-1: Where the processing of Personal Data is in the public interest, in the exercise of official powers granted to the Data Controller or on the grounds of a legitimate interest of the Data Controller, Users may object to such processing by providing a reason in relation to their particular situation to justify their objection.
privacy_policy.10-content-2: Users should be aware, however, that in the event that their Personal Data are processed for commercial purposes, they may object at any time to such processing without justification. In order to find out whether Users’ Personal Data are being processed by the Data Controller for commercial purposes, Users should consult the relevant sections of this document.
privacy_policy.11-content-1: Any request to exercise the User’s rights may be addressed to the Data Controller via the contact details provided herein. Such requests will be processed by the Data Controller free of charge as soon as possible and always within one month..
privacy_policy.12-title: Additional information on data collection and processing Legal defence
privacy_policy.12-content-1: The User’s Personal Data may be used for the legal defence of the Data Subject in court or in the judicial phases prior to a possible lawsuit arising from the inappropriate use of this Application or the related Services.
privacy_policy.12-content-2: The User declares to be aware that the Data Subject may be required by public authorities to disclose Personal Data.
privacy_policy.13-title: Additional information about User Personal Data
privacy_policy.13-content-1: In addition to the information contained in this privacy policy, this Application may provide the User with additional and contextual information relating to specific Services or to the collection and processing of Personal Data.
privacy_policy.14-content-1: For operation and maintenance purposes, this Application and any other services provided by third parties that are used may collect a system log, i.e. files that record interaction with this Application and that may contain Personal Data, such as the User’s IP address, among others.
privacy_policy.15-title: Information not contained in this privacy policy
privacy_policy.15-content-1: Additional information about the collection and processing of Personal Data may be requested from the Data Controller at any time. The contact information is indicated at the beginning of this document.
privacy_policy.16-title: How “Do Not Track” requests are processed
privacy_policy.16-content-1: This Application does not allow “Do Not Track” requests.
privacy_policy.16-content-2: To determine whether any of the third party services you use accept “Do Not Track” requests, please read their privacy policies.
privacy_policy.17-content-1: The Owner reserves the right to modify this privacy policy at any time by notifying Users through this page and, if possible, through this Application and/or if technically and legally possible by notifying Users directly, if the Owner has the necessary contact information for this purpose. It is strongly recommended that you check this page frequently, taking as a reference the date of the last update indicated at the bottom of the page.
privacy_policy.17-content-2: In the event that the changes affect the processing activities carried out on the basis of the User’s consent, the Controller shall, if necessary, obtain the User’s new consent.
privacy_policy.18-content-1: This privacy policy has been drafted based on the provisions of multiple legislations, including Arts.and 1413 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation).
privacy_policy.18-content-2: This privacy policy applies only to this Application or eTrust websites, which may be etrust.herokuapp.com or etrustapp.com or similar, unless otherwise stated herein.
privacy_policy.18-content-3: You can request the forms necessary to exercise these rights by sending an email to the email address provided in this document.
privacy_policy.18-content-4: Given the very personal nature of the exercise of any of these rights, you must attach a copy of your identity card or equivalent supporting document to your request.
privacy_policy.18-content-5: You can contact the Spanish Data Protection Agency to obtain additional information about your rights or to file a complaint with it, especially when you have not obtained satisfaction in the exercise of your rights, obtaining all the information necessary to do so through the website www.agpd.es.

terms_and_conditions.title: Terms and Conditions
terms_and_conditions.1-content-1: These terms of use (“Terms of Use”) apply to all use of the eTrust websites (the “Website”), including but not limited to, etrustapp.com, etrust.herokuapp.com or similar sites.
terms_and_conditions.1-content-2: The Website is provided by eTrust, general.etrust@gmail.com. In these Terms of Use, the words “we”, “to us”, “us” and/or “our” refer to eTrust.
terms_and_conditions.1-content-3: These Terms of Use are deemed to include all other guidelines, policies and operating rules referred to herein or which we may otherwise publish on our Website (as such guidelines, policies and rules may be amended from time to time), including but not limited to:
terms_and_conditions.1-content-4: Our “eTrust website usage guidelines for users” ( “Usage guidelines”).
terms_and_conditions.1-content-6: In the event of any conflict between the terms and conditions contained herein and those contained in the Usage guidelines, the Usage guidelines shall prevail.
terms_and_conditions.1-content-7: By using the Website, you agree to be bound by the Terms of Use, including the Usage guidelines. If you do not agree to these Terms of Use, please discontinue your use of the Website. Registration as a user requires your express acceptance of these Terms of Use.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-2: 1.1 To gain full access to use the Website, you must create a profile and register as a user (hereinafter referred to as “Registered User”).
terms_and_conditions.2-content-3: 1.2 You must be aged 18 years or older to become a Registered User.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-4: 1.3 You are only allowed to register one profile per person on the Website. The profile is personal and non-transferable.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-5: 1.4 To become a  Registered User, you need a password. You choose your own password, which you must use together with your e-mail address when accessing the Website. The password is personal to you and you must not pass it on or otherwise make it available to third parties. It is your responsibility to ensure that the password does not fall into the hands of third parties. If you become aware that your password has been or may have been compromised, you are obliged to notify us. We may change the password and will do so if there is a risk that it has been compromised or used in contravention of the Terms of Use.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-6: 1.5 During the registration process, you must choose a username. The username will be displayed on the website whenever you write or comment on reviews, or generate User Generated Content (UGC) (see 2.1 below) on the Website. You should therefore consider whether you wish to use a username by which others can identify you. The username must not (i) be offensive or otherwise insulting, (ii) include the terms “Guest”, “Admin”, “.es”, “.com”, etc., or (iii) contain characteristics of third parties, or personal names to which you do not own the rights. You warrant that your username does not infringe any rights (including intellectual property rights) belonging to any third party or relating to the Terms of use. If you have chosen to upload a profile picture, the restrictions and warranties set out in this clause apply to your profile picture and you confirm that you have all rights to the image.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-7: 1.6 We have the right to delete, suspend or modify your profile at any time, without prior notice and without prejudice, in the event of a breach or alleged breach by you of these Terms of use or applicable law. By deleting your profile, you will no longer have access to the services on the website that require you to be registered and you will no longer be able to log in as a Registered User. When your profile is deleted, we reserve the right to delete the User Generated Content (see 2.1) that you have created on the website.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-8: 1.7 We also reserve the right to delete your profile and User Generated Content (see 2.1) at any time and without prior notice or explanation.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-9: 1.8 You are not permitted to access or attempt to access those parts of the website that require you to be a registered user if you are not a registered user.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-11: 2.1 To the fullest extent permitted by law, the rights (including all intellectual property rights) in any materials, information, notices, reviews, articles or other communications (hereinafter “User Generated Content” o “UGC”), created by Registered Users on the Website, are licensed to eTrust for use on a non-exclusive basis. The Registered Users shall not be entitled to receive any royalties or any other remuneration or fees in connection with such UGC. We may use and transfer the UGC freely. Our access on non-exclusive terms to freely use the UGC shall apply irrevocably, without limitation in time or territory.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-12: 2.2 Registered Users are responsible for the UGC they post on the website.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-13: 2.3 Registered Users warrant that all UGC they post on the website is correct and true (when stating facts) or that they really mean it (when stating opinions).
terms_and_conditions.2-content-14: 2.4 The rules on what Registered Users may write are set out in the Guidelines for Use.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-15: 2.5 Registered Users shall not publish on the website, CGU that: is of a commercial nature or for commercial purposes; is unlawful, false, misleading, fraudulent, threatening, abusive, harassing, defamatory, libellous, defamatory, obscene, pornographic or profane; is of a sexist, political or racial nature; infringes the rights of third parties, including any intellectual property rights; is offensive or otherwise in breach of any applicable local, national or international law or regulation; violates these Terms of use, including the Usage guidelines; unlawful purpose or content (or promotes unlawful purposes); is technically harmful (including, but not limited to, computer viruses, logic bombs, Trojan horses, worms, harmful components, corrupted data or other malicious software, data or harmful conduct).
terms_and_conditions.2-content-16: 2.6 Registered Users providing UGC warrant in every context that the UGC is lawful and complies with the Terms of Use. In the event that we receive a notification or otherwise become aware that the UGC violates applicable law and/or the Terms of Use, we may, without prior notification, remove the UGC and, depending on the nature of the violation, report the violation to the victim and/or the authorities. Our right of removal shall not be subject to any explanation, although we will do our best to inform the Registered Users about the removal and the reasons for it.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-17: 2.7 The Registered User hereby grants us the right to take such legal action as we deem necessary in the event of a breach of the UGC of the Registered User.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-18: 2.8 The Registered User must indemnify us against any claims that may be brought against us as a result of the Registered User´s violation of the terms of use, the Usage guidelines or current law.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-19: The Registered User shall hold us harmless and indemnify us from and against any claims or losses caused by third party claims against us resulting from the Registered User’s UGC. We may at any time request information about the UGC from the Registered User, iincluding supporting documentation for the information contained in the UGC. The Registered User must, for example, document that the UGC is based on an actual purchase or service experience in an actual customer relationship with the company to which the el UGC refers.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-21: 3.1 The content of the website, incluidos, including but not limited to intellectual property rights, text, features, graphics, icons, photos, calculations, references and software, is owned by eTrust or a third party owner (other than the Registered User). n the event that you provide comments, ideas or suggestions regarding the website or the services offered on the website (the “Submissions”), we may freely and fully exploit such submissions.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-22: 3.2 Unauthorised copying, distribution, display or other unauthorised use of the website or any part thereof constitutes a violation of law, and may result in civil and criminal penalties.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-23: 3.3 To the maximum extent permitted by law, the rights of free use of the UGC are irrevocably transferred to us, without limitation in time or territory, upon submission of the UGC.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-24: 3.4 Downloads or other digital copies of the content of the website or parts thereof are only permitted for personal, non-commercial use, unless agreed with us in writing, or as permitted by applicable mandatory legislation.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-25: 3.5 All company names, trademarks and other business features on the website are or will become the property of eTrust or a third party (other than the Registered User)and must only be used for commercial purposes after obtaining our approval or the approval of the third party owner, respectively.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-27: We carry out different types of processing of personal data in connection with the use of the website.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-28: Personal data is processed in accordance with our Privacy Policy, which is available on our website.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-29: By agreeing to these Terms of use, you confirm that you have read and accepted our Privacy Policy
terms_and_conditions.2-content-31: 5.1 The website, the content and the services offered on the website are provided “as they are” and we make no warranty as to the content or accuracy of the UGC or the website, and we shall not be liable for any removal or blocking by us or others of the UGC. We may at any time, at our sole discretion and in our sole discretion, remove or block the UGC or the website. We expressly exclude all conditions, warranties and other terms which might otherwise be implied by statute, common law or in equity.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-32: 5.2 We will not review or monitor the UGC posted on the website. Notwithstanding the foregoing, we may at any time investigate and correct (including anonymising) the UGC, for example, if such actions are (i) requested by third parties, (ii) required under applicable law, or (iii) necessary for the UGC to comply with our Usage guidelines.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-33: 5.3 We are not responsible for the content of the UGC. Our disclaimer applies to all UGC, including UGC that has been edited by us (see 5.2). We are not responsible for any links to third party websites in the UGC, including the content of the page to which the UGC links.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-34: 5.4 Recommendations, reviews, comments, etc. of specific companies, services, internet companies, etc. on the website are for guidance only. We are in no way responsible for the content of the website. The use of eTrust is in all respects the sole responsibility of the Registered Users. We are not responsible for the availability of the website or the UGC.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-35: 5.5 In no event shall we be liable for any damages for any use of the website, including (i) loss of profits, loss of contracts, loss of turnover, loss of business, loss of business opportunities, loss or corruption of data or data recovery, loss of goodwill, breach of security resulting from the failure of a third party’s telecommunications and/or the internet, (ii) any loss or damage resulting from liability to third parties (whether direct, indirect or consequential) or (iii) any indirect or consequential loss or damage.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-36: 5.6 Nothing in the Terms of Use excludes or limits our liability for death or personal injury arising from negligence, or liability for fraudulent misrepresentation or misrepresentation as to a fundamental matter, or any other liability which cannot be excluded or limited under applicable law.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-38: 6.1 We may, at any time and without prior notice, revise or modify these Terms of use or, at our discretion and without prior notice, close, change or reorganize the website. As a Registered User, you agree to be bound by the terms of use in effect at all times. Any revisions or changes to the terms of use will be posted on the website. Registered users agree that their continued use of the website followingthe posting of any modified version of the Terms of Use constitutes acceptance of the modified Terms of Use.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-39: 6.2 If any of these Terms of Use shall be deemed unlawful or void and therefore unenforceable, the applicability and enforceability of the remaining Terms of Use shall not be affected.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-41: 7.1 We may terminate your right to access and use the services offered on the websitem at any time and for any reason without liability. If we do so, or if you choose to delete your profile, any rights granted to you hereunder will terminate immediately. Section 2-8 shall survive any termination of the Terms of Use.
terms_and_conditions.2-content-43: 8.1 The Terms of Use are governed by Spanish law and, unless otherwise stated, the general rules of Spanish law shall apply to all dealings between us and Registered Users and users of the website. Any dispute shall be submitted to the court of eTrust’s Spanish jurisdiction, unless it would violate mandatory jurisdiction rules.
